Correct answer is C .. CyclicBarrier constructor takes as arguments the maximum number of threads until release and a Runnable Object .. 
CyclicBarrier cb = new CyclicBarrier( int i , RunnableObject) ;

Selected Answer: C
C is correct, since second argument for CyclicBarrier is Runnable which will be executed when barrier is fulfilled.

Answer is C.
Output : Master! Worker.
Question is 'both the Worker and Master classes are executed'.
If new CyclicBarrier(1);
is output : Worker.

comments.content: In question there is no need to execute Master 2nd time.
C is OK. Master is executed as Runnable.

discussion.content:
Answer is B. 
Constructors for CyclicBarrier CyclicBarrier(int parties), CyclicBarrier(int parties, Runnable barrierAction) - Creates a new CyclicBarrier that will trip when the given number of parties (threads) are waiting upon it, and which will execute the given barrier action when the barrier is tripped, performed by the last thread entering the barrier
So 2nd parameter is what will be done after tripping barrier.

choices.B: At line n2, insert CyclicBarrier cb = new CyclicBarrier(1);
choices.A: At line n2, insert CyclicBarrier cb = new CyclicBarrier(2, master);
choices.C: At line n2, insert CyclicBarrier cb = new CyclicBarrier(1, master);
choices.D: At line n2, insert CyclicBarrier cb = new CyclicBarrier(master);

questions.question_text: Which action can be used to load a database driver by using JDBC3.0?

choices.C: Use the DriverManager.getDriver method to load the driver class.
choices.B: Include the JDBC driver class in a java.lang.Class.forName method to load the driver class.
choices.A: Add the driver class to the META-INF/services folder of the JAR file. jdbc.properties file.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B, Include the JDBC driver class in a java.lang.Class.forName method to load the driver class.
